sections.title: Overview
sections.content: This guide helps resolve common lab access issues in the PCTE environment. Follow these steps to diagnose and fix access problems.

sections.title: Quick Diagnosis
sections.content:
Can't see lab in portal? → Check enrollment status
Lab shows but won't launch? → Verify browser compatibility
Lab crashes after launch? → Check system requirements
Permission denied error? → Contact administrator

sections.title: Step 1: Verify Account Status
sections.content: Log into the Training Portal with your PCTE credentials. Navigate to My Profile → Account Status. Verify your account shows as Active. Check that your role includes Lab Access permission. If locked, wait 15 minutes or contact Help Desk.

sections.title: Step 2: Check Lab Environment Availability
sections.content: Go to Training Portal → Available Labs. Verify the lab you want to access is listed. Check the lab status indicator (green = available). Look for maintenance windows in the announcements. If lab is unavailable, try an alternative module.

sections.title: Step 3: Browser Requirements
sections.content:
Supported: Chrome 90+, Firefox 88+, Edge 90+
Not supported: Internet Explorer, Safari on Windows
Clear browser cache: Ctrl+Shift+Delete
Disable extensions: Try incognito/private mode
Enable JavaScript and WebSockets

sections.title: Step 4: Network Connectivity
sections.content:
On-site: Ensure you're on PCTE network
Remote: Verify VPN connection to PCTE
Check VPN client version (must be 2.3+)
Verify firewall allows ports: 443, 8080, 8443
Test connectivity: ping lab.pcte.mil

sections.title: Step 5: Module-Specific Access
sections.content: Confirm you've completed prerequisite modules. Verify you're enrolled in the correct training course. Check module completion status in dashboard. For advanced modules, verify instructor approval.

errors.solution: Contact training administrator to update role
Check announcements or try different lab

errors.cause: Incorrect module ID or not enrolled
errors.solution: Verify module number and enrollment status
Check VPN, firewall, and network connection
Switch to Chrome, Firefox, or Edge

sections.title: Advanced Troubleshooting
sections.content: If basic steps don't work: Clear all browser data, Try different network, Check system resources (4GB+ RAM, 2GB free disk), Verify SSO status at sso.pcte.mil

sections.title: When to Contact Support
sections.content: Response time: 2 hours during business hours. Ticket priority: High. Include in ticket: Lab module number, Error message, Browser/OS version, Steps already tried
